fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Consumers, Culture, Education and training, Business and Industry, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: Copyright, patents, consumer law, economy, research, education, interoperability, public procurements, net neutrality, forced sales, privacy, mass surveillance
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
April maintains close contacts with : 
 - international, European and national associations which 
promotes and defend Free Software (Free Software Foundation...) 
- organisations for Free Information Infrastructure, net 
neutrality (FFII, La Quadrature du Net,...) 
- consumer organisations (BEUC,TACD...)
goals__remit:
Founded in 1996, April is the main French advocacy association devoted to promote and protect Free/Libre Software ("Logiciel Libre" in French). With more than 4000 members (individuals, businesses, associations and organizations), April is a pioneer of Free Software in France.  
 
Since 1996, it is a major player in the democratization and the spread of free software and open standards to the general public, professionals and institutions in the French-speaking world. It also acts as a watchdog on digital freedoms, warning the public about the dangers of private interests keeping an exclusive stranglehold on information and knowledge. 
 
Pioneer of free software in France, April has been since 1996 a major player in the democratization and the spread of Free Software and open standards to the general 
public, professionals and institutions in the French-speaking world. In the digital era that is ours, it also aims to inform the public on the dangers of an exclusive 
appropriation of information an knowledge by private interests. The association is made up of individuals, companies, associations and organizations from various backgrounds who share the values of freedom. 
 
Mobilizing its volunteer members and its full-time employees allows April to participate actively in the 
recognition of Free Software through many varied activities.
